Name: resorcinol production, hydrolysis of meta-phenylene diamine | o-phenylene diamine | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Resorcinol is produced by nitration of benzene to o-,m- and para-dinitrophenylene, followed by hydrogenation of separed nitrobenzene isomeres. Para- and ortho-phenylenediamine isomers are produced as by-products and separated by distillation before further hydrogenation of meta-phenylenediamine to resorcinol.;References:;Thebeeapelo J. K. (2002): The investigation of the hydrolysis reaction of m-phenylene diamine to resorcinol, Master Thesis, Port Elizabeth Technikon.
